stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains how increases in agricultural productivity in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries created the conditions for industrialization in western Europe?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of industrialization in the nineteenth century.

choicesHtml: The increases raised the profitability of agriculture for large landowners.
The increases freed up labor that was no longer needed to produce food.
The increases led to larger sizes of draft and food animals on European farms.
The increases diminished the occurrence of famines in Europe starting in the eighteenth century.
